meanings.definition: A smaller division or part of a larger region
meanings.sent1: There are many subregions within the national park, each with its own unique features.
meanings.sent2: The subregions of the city have distinct characteristics that set them apart from each other.
meanings.sent3: In the land of Suburbia, the subregions were known as the Mini-Districts, each ruled by a different mayor.
meanings.sent4: The subregions of the brain function like specialized teams, each handling a specific task.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the subregions of the ocean floor revealed a hidden world teeming with life.

meanings.definition: A subdivision within a larger region or area
meanings.sent1: The wine region is divided into subregions based on the types of grapes grown in each area.
meanings.sent2: Each subregion of the forest has its own ecosystem and wildlife population.
meanings.sent3: The subregions of the enchanted forest were like secret realms waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Just like puzzle pieces, the subregions of the map fit together perfectly to form the whole picture.
meanings.sent5: Navigating through the subregions of the maze required careful planning and a good sense of direction.
